comments.author: decodx
comments.body: I watched the documentary and I have to say, it's well-made and very informative. It's crazy how many people have been scammed and lost their money. I have always been wary of these so-called investment platforms and this just confirms my suspicions. @OP, just wanted to suggest that maybe the Bitcoin board isn't the best place for this particular topic. It might be more helpful to move it to the Beginners & Help section. Just a thought!

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: I have always been intrigue with those investigators who does their job with their identity exposed to the public it's a very risky job if you ask me, because you never can tell who it is that you're investigating and how dangerous the person or organisation is.Although, I didn't get to watch the entire video but some parts I saw gave off a big red flag. Most especially the part where the man was asked to invest more so he could gain back what he has lose to scam trading, it's more like they were asking him to chance his loss.They really did a very nice job in the documentary.Quote from: cafter on April 22, 2023, 07:14:29 PMyes, some days ago I also came across this type of scam in telegram, I first applied for a job on linkedin then someone contacted me through whatsapp and shared a telegram group for job.after joining telegram group there are 200 members in that group, and they were posting that they received payment after investing. the offer was like this: invest $500 get $750 in 10minutes, the group was so convincing that anyone who has knowledge about this scam may be also get trapped I was going to invest a small amount to test it. When it comes to telegram one must be extremely careful because telegram is more like the den of scammers pretending to be parts of the company since it's very easy to wear the profile of the company and it's also easy to wear the company name and unlike linkedin and most other social media where you can see the past history of the account you're dealing with.That's why it's advisable to always make sure you disable the options that allows unknown numbers to be able to contact you on telegram, that way you won't be receiving PMs from those possing as member of some known company/projects.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: cafter on April 22, 2023, 07:14:29 PMI was going to invest a small amount to test it. (there was many offer start from $20-$1000, + 50% in 10minutes)but when seeing peoples profile who joined that group are all downloaded profile picture from different social media and stock imagesand i left that group they create their scamming business by using much brain. any educated person also get convinced to invest small.Mind you that you shouldn't try something like this out with a small amount of money to determine their legitimacy, because more often than not when you invest in this scam with a small amount of money they are going to pay you your ROI, they do this for you to build a stronger trust in their scam platform, and the moment you do that and invest with a larger sum of money, that's when they would do their exit scam with your money, thus don't try to test stuffs like this out, just exit whatever group it is, or if it was a personal message, block the sender ASAP.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: In addition, just because your favorite media personality advertises a service, doesn't mean it's OK to trust it. Always remember they're getting paid for it and may not do their own due diligence before accepting the offer not to mention, not everyone can do a proper research and assess the risk involved. Who knows maybe their "research" is looking up trustpilot reviews which are easily filled with fake reviews.Pointing this out cause the fake exchange appears to have gained credibility after sponsoring a known sports team. It's perfectly fine to become a fan of someone but we should all know our limits and not give in to weird parasocial attachments.

comments.author: touseefahmad1999
comments.body: It's good that you were able to recognize the red flags and did not fall for the scam. Scammers often use convincing tactics and promises of easy money to lure people into investing. It's important to always do your own research and be cautious when it comes to investing your money. Remember that if something seems too good to be true, it probably is. If you ever have any doubts or concerns, it's always best to seek advice from a trusted financial advisor or do more research before making any decisions.

That's if we take out ignorance. No one should expect to reap where they didn't show. I don't feel any pity for those who get caught in such because of greed. They deserve it.

comments.body: Scammers are everywhere and they are now working in group to convince you not to smell something fishery.
